author: robocopsgonemad
content: I see an SSZ convo going on, perhaps someone here can clarify something for me.  vectors are 0xN01 terminated, but i'm not sure I understand why.  According to the serialization section here: https://www.ssz.dev/overview it allows for "the length of the vector becomes part of the object itself" but i don't see how.

author: robocopsgonemad
content: wait... is it just that "01...00" is treated as a flag, and you'd never have that in data since you can't actually land on the 32bit boundary.

author: robocopsgonemad
